alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:02AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARION AND SOUTHWESTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES THROUGH 530 AM EDT... At 502 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Fort McCoy, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort McCoy, Fruitland, Lake Delancy, Welaka, and Hog Valley. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam
